title: Discharge of Debtor Letter
question: Hello,
answers: The debtor obligation to pay DISCHARGEABLE debts no longer exists and the creditor who hold debts that can be discharged (not all debts can be discharged) no longer has the right to try and collect.

The letter you received means that the Court has given the debtor their legal permission to not pay their debts. You don't need to do anything else.
